snippet: In a rural pocket of Wyoming, residents have long complained of unsafe water, and as they await definitive scientific testing, many blame nearby hydraulic fracturing.
abstract: Small group of farmers and landowners in rural Wyoming have complained for several years that their water wells have been contaminated with chemicals used in hydraulic fracturing; residents have been provided with makeshift solutions for supplies of fresh water while they wait for definitive results from testing that has been conducted on the local water supply.
lead_paragraph: In a rural pocket of Wyoming, residents have long complained of unsafe water, and as they await definitive scientific testing, many blame nearby hydraulic fracturing.

headline.seo: In Land of Hydraulic Fracturing, a Battle Over Water Pollution
headline.main: In Land of Gas Drilling, Battle for Water That Doesn’t Reek or Fizz
headline.print_headline: In Land of Gas Drilling, Battle for Water That Doesn’t Reek or Fizz
